Question
========

Suppose it is given that for a given patient population, the haemoglobin (Hb) level is normally distributed with μ = 8.10 and σ = 1.20. We randomly draw an individual from this population. How high should the Hb of this person be at most to belong to the lowest 10% of the population of the population?

Answerlist
----------

* 6.56
* 6.82
* 7.8
* 9.64

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 6.56: Correct
* 6.82: Incorrect
* 7.8: Incorrect
* 9.64: Incorrect
